data.title: The Best Movies Directed By Guy Ritchie, Ranked
data.meta_description: Over 1K filmgoers have voted on the 10+ films on Best Movies Directed By Guy Ritchie, Ranked. Current Top 3: Snatch, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, The ...
data.text:
Ranked By

3.5K votes

1.0K voters

Voting Rules

Vote up the best films directed by Guy Ritchie.

With over 1,000 movie fans casting votes, this list of the best movies directed by Guy Ritchie is the perfect guide for those looking to explore his uniquely creative style. Across a career spanning decades, Guy Ritchie has established himself as one of Hollywood's most distinctive directors. His films are known for their thrilling action sequences, sharp dialogue, and inventive camera work that keeps viewers hooked from start to finish.

From cult classics like Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels to blockbuster hits such as Aladdin and The Man from U.N.C.L.E., there's something on this list for everyone who appreciates Ritchie's unique brand of filmmaking. Fans love how he takes classic stories and injects them with an edgy sense of humor that keeps audiences coming back for more. Whether you're a longtime admirer or just discovering his work now, these are the must-see films helmed by one of modern cinemaâ€™s brightest stars. So why not take a look at the list below and vote up your favorite Guy Ritchie flicks?

Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Brad Pitt

Released : 2000

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Crime, Comedy, Thriller

Why Should I Watch Snatch: An exhilarating ride of a film, Snatch showcases Ritchie's signature blend of humor, action, and clever dialogue. The ensemble cast includes Brad Pitt and Jason Statham, who deliver stellar performances in this high-octane crime comedy that will leave viewers enthralled with its dynamic plot twists and memorable characters.

Snatch, a crime comedy directed by Guy Ritchie, is an energetic caper set in the underbelly of London's seedy underworld. Frankie Four Fingers (Benicio Del Toro) steals a priceless diamond, unwittingly setting off a chain of events involving shady characters like Turkish (Jason Statham), a boxing promoter, and Tommy (Stephen Graham), his naive partner. Add to this mix Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones), an enforcer with a reputation as solid as his moniker suggests, and you have a chaotic scramble for power and wealth. This film weaves together multiple subplots that are as unpredictable as they are entertaining.

Released : 1998

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Crime, Comedy, Drama

Why Should I Watch Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels: Guy Ritchie's directorial debut remains a beloved classic for fans of British crime cinema. This fast-paced action-comedy features an intricate web of interconnected storylines that unfold in Ritchie's trademark gritty London setting, resulting in a wildly entertaining and influential work that still holds up today.

In the heart of London's gritty underworld, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels is a crime comedy that spins an intricate web of chaos and humor. The plot centers on Eddy (Nick Moran), a card shark who, along with his friends Tom (Jason Flemyng), Soap (Dexter Fletcher), and Bacon (Jason Statham), finds himself owing a hefty debt to Hatchet Harry (P.H. Moriarty). In their desperate bid to repay the debt, they stumble upon two antique shotguns and unwittingly get tangled in a turf war. Directed by Guy Ritchie, this film boasts of a unique storytelling style interspersed with offbeat humor and won the BAFTA Audience Award for Best British Film.

3

The Gentlemen

Matthew McConaughey, Charlie Hunnam, Michelle Dockery

Released : 2019

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Action, Crime, Comedy

Why Should I Watch The Gentlemen: Bringing his distinct style to the world of modern gangsters, Guy Ritchie crafts another captivating tale with The Gentlemen. Featuring powerhouse performances from Matthew McConaughey, Charlie Hunnam, and Hugh Grant, this film offers razor-sharp wit alongside thrilling action scenes that keep audiences hooked until the very end.

Mickey Pearson is an American expatriate who became rich by building a highly profitable marijuana empire in London. When word gets out that he's looking to cash out of the business, it soon triggers an array of plots and schemes -- including bribery and blackmail -- from shady characters who want to steal his domain.

Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson, Thandie Newton

Released : 2008

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Action, Crime, Comedy

Why Should I Watch RocknRolla: A love letter to London's criminal underworld, RocknRolla delivers on all fronts with its stylish visuals, engaging characters, and expertly crafted narrative. Tom Hardy joins Gerard Butler and Thandie Newton among others in this slick thriller filled with unexpected turns that will leave viewers eager for more.

Old-school mobster Lenny Cole (Tom Wilkinson) rules London's underworld with an iron fist and a score of well-greased palms. As big-time gangsters and petty crooks all scramble to get their cut of a Russian mobster's crooked land deal, street-wise hustler One Two (Gerard Butler) tries to play both sides of the fence as the lucrative deal falls into the lap of Lenny's presumed-dead son.

Robert Downey, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams

Released : 2009

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Crime, Mystery

Why Should I Watch Sherlock Holmes: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's beloved detective gets a fresh update under Guy Ritchie's direction as Robert Downey Jr.'s portrayal breathes new life into the iconic character. With airtight storytelling paired with dazzling action sequences set against Victorian London's backdrop; it offers both die-hard fans of the franchise and newcomers alike plenty to enjoy.

When a string of brutal murders terrorizes London, it doesn't take long for legendary detective Sherlock Holmes (Robert Downey Jr.) and his crime-solving partner, Dr. Watson (Jude Law), to find the killer, Lord Blackwood (Mark Strong). A devotee of the dark arts, Blackwood has a bigger scheme in mind, and his execution plays right into his plans. The game is afoot when Blackwood seems to rise from the grave, plunging Holmes and Watson into the world of the occult and strange technologies.

Released : 2015

Directed by : Guy Ritchie

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Comedy

Why Should I Watch The Man from U.N.C.L.E: Ritchie's penchant for tight storytelling and stylish visuals is on full display in this slick adaptation of the classic 1960s television series. Henry Cavill and Armie Hammer's magnetic chemistry elevates the action-packed spy thriller, making it an exciting watch for fans of espionage and fast-paced cinema.

At the height of the Cold War, a mysterious criminal organization plans to use nuclear weapons and technology to upset the fragile balance of power between the United States and Soviet Union. CIA agent Napoleon Solo (Henry Cavill) and KGB agent Illya Kuryakin (Armie Hammer) are forced to put aside their hostilities and work together to stop the evildoers in their tracks. The duo's only lead is the daughter of a missing German scientist, whom they must find soon to prevent a global catastrophe.
